entry.title: Moved last_recording_ to CanvasResourceProvider
entry.content:
The logic for preserving the last recording needed for vector

printing was distributed between the Canvas2DLayerBridge and the

CanvasResourceProvider, making the logic needlessly complex.

CanvasResourceProvider::FlushCanvas had logic for determining whether

the recording should be kept, but the Canvas2DLayerBridge was the one

keeping it. CanvasResourceProvider::FlushCanvas only returned the

recording if it meant for the bridge to keep it. This prevented any

other callers, unit tests for instance, from having access to flushed

recordings.



By moving all the logic to the provider, the code is simpler and

FlushCanvas can now return the recording unconditionally.



Bug: 1484741

entry.title: [SidePanelPinning] Move the browser root action to browser instead of browser view.
entry.content:
Previously the the root action was tied to the BrowserView. However, since many views are created in the construction of the BrowserView the Browser does not have access to the window(). This means that the views cannot translate a browser to a BrowserView at that time in their initialization.



This CL adds the root_action_item to the Browser. Since BrowserView holds an unique_ptr to this, it sets the actionItem in its action_initializer.

entry.title: [wallets] Refactor: Use Digital Credential as a generic term for MDoc
entry.content:
This CL is a pure rename refactoring from MDocs -> Digital Credential,

inspired by the choice of terms that the OpenID4VP group has taken:



https://openid.net/wg/digital-credentials-protocols/



We made the API format agnostic, so we can use the generic term

Digital Credential (in the context of the digitalization of government

issued credentials).



Verifiable Credentials occurred to us as another

generic option, but we were worried it could be confused with VC, the

spec.

entry.title: [web-tests] Fix incorrect fuzziness parameter minimums
entry.content:
A W(P)T may specify fuzziness parameters as either an inclusive range

[min, max], or a single expected value [1] (e.g., `totalPixels=30` means

exactly 30 pixels must be different for a test/reference to match).



This patch corrects a few tests that mistakenly reject exact matches

(i.e., maxDifference = totalPixels = 0) because they specify exact

nonzero parameters. WPT unfortunately doesn't interpret this as `0-`,

even though this is almost always what we want in practice.



`run_web_tests.py` allowed these parameters to land because it ignores

fuzzy parameters when the image hashes match exactly. Now, to be

consistent with [1] and its implementation in wptrunner, only skip

diffing when exact matches are expected.



[1]: https://web-platform-tests.org/writing-tests/reftests.html#fuzzy-matching



Bug: 1254776

Change-Id: I868e571a891b2a570934d17dd605f42db22a0ddf

entry.title: Use string_view whenever possible in WebString
entry.content:
Separating out ptr/data pairs is both less safe and less ergnomic. If we

keep values in paired up view types as much as possible, there's less

risk of lengths and data getting mixed up.



This also avoids needing separate overloads for all variations on

string. string_view (or optional for FromUTF16) is a

sink type that can accept all variations.

entry.title: [iOS] Fix DCHECK Hit in Privacy Safe Browsing Settings Page
entry.content:
The DCHECK was getting hit due to an asynchronized UI sequence that

happens when creating coordinators. This happens when a user opens up

the setting page, slides down to remove it, and then quickly opens the

setting page again. Although this is a rare occurrence, DCHECKs are

supposed to be invariant, and seeing as this is possible, we should

do any clean up explicitly to ensure that a coordinator is reset

when re-opening it.



Fixed: 1489105

entry.title: sensors: Rework cardinality of SensorProviderProxyImpl, rename classes
entry.content:
This is done in preparation for the upcoming virtual sensor patches that

implement the Automation section of the Generic Sensor spec, as a

virtual sensor created in an iframe should be visible and used by other

frames in the same page. Virtual sensor settings should also persist

across navigations in the same tab (so that WebDriver users can do the

setup before loading the page under test, for example).



SensorProviderProxyImpl has been split into two classes:

- WebContentsSensorProviderProxy is a per-WebContents object (i.e. there

is only one regardless of the number of frames in the same tab, and it

persists across navigations in the same tab). It contains the

mojo::Remote that communicates with //services and calls GetSensor()

in SensorProviderImpl.

- FrameSensorProviderProxy is a per-RenderFrameHost object that contains

the mojo::ReceiverSet that Blink reaches when calling GetSensor(). It

performs all permission checks and then reaches into

WebContentsSensorProviderProxy to forward the call to //services.



This means that all calls to e.g. GetSensor() from Blink coming from the

same page (regardless of the frame) are routed to //services via the

same object (and therefore same mojo::ReceiverId from a //services

perspective), which also results in fewer Mojo connections between

content and services. The existing permission and permission policy

checks remain though, so this change has no user-visible effects.



WebContentsSensorProviderProxy still needs to be aware of

FrameSensorProviderProxy because it needs to notify one or more

instances that its mojo::ReceiverSet needs to be cleared due to a Mojo

connection error on the //services side.



Bug: 1278377

entry.title: [shared storage] Let worklet inherit the OT features from the creator document
entry.content:
Why: Regular worklets inherent the creator document's OT features

(https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/workers/threaded_worklet_messaging_proxy.cc?q=GetInheritedTrialFeatures).



Thus, make the shared storage worklet do the same.



How: upon worklet creation (i.e. addModule()), propagate the OT features

from Window (renderer) --> SharedStorageWorkletHost (browser) -->

SharedStoargeWorkletGlobalScope (renderer).



With the OT features propagated, we can remove the special case

handling in SharedStorageWorkletGlobalScope::FeatureEnabled().

entry.title: [anchor-position] Implement per-axis scroll adjustment
entry.content:
The spec recently refined the scroll adjustment to be per-axis [1].

This patch implements that in Blink by:



1. Store whether scroll adjustment is needed in NGLayoutResult's

rare data. This is because the info depends on the used style,

which isn't available before layout. Besides, the rare data isn't

populated if neither axis needs scroll adjustment, so we won't

create a rare data for every out-of-flow object.



2. Use the per-axis info to calculate the translation offset on both

main thread and compositor.



This patch also renames a few `HasTranslation` to

`NeedsScrollAdjustment` to match the terms defined in the spec.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-anchor-position-1/#needs-scroll-adjustment



Bug: 1473388

Change-Id: I55242103550f06db92910659613b54564c81f1f0

entry.title: New System Toast View
entry.content:
Implement a new SystemToastView that will replace SystemToastStyle.

This class is now part of ash/system/toast instead of ash/style.



Logic and code was simplified by:

- Use views::Builder pattern to create view contents

- Receive a `ToastData` object instead of individual params

- Remove `ComputeInsets()` functions and set margins directly

- Remove controller logic from the class



Updated to match go/toast-style-spec:

- Shadow changed from `cros.sys.system-elevation-2` to `elevation-1`.

- Font changed from `kLegacyBody1` to `kCrosBody2`.

- `SetBackdropFilterQuality()` is called to optimize background blur.



Also added dedicated view and pixel tests.



Migration to use this new view in the toast manager and other sites will

be implemented in the next CLs.

multi-line: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6nAEpUWYgfDssED

entry.title: [iOS] Add Remind Me Later to default browser video promo
entry.content:
This CL adds the backend functionality to display the default browser

promo again after the user taps remind me later.



The main changes here are adding a new FET feature and default browser

promo for this. That way, when the user taps on the Remind Me Later

button, a new "DefaultBrowserRemindMeLater" promo can be registered

with its own set of FET rules. These rules can skip over some of the

group-wide rules, like only showing a promo once per month.



The FET rules can also be configured server-side to allow for easier

experimentation over remind me later delay.



Bug: 1488953

Change-Id: I42e25572a775efddbe2662d38d55f426bc840af8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4904150

Reviewed-by: Guillaume Jenkins

entry.title: view-transition: Fix DOMViewTransition null-ptr crash
entry.content:
InvokeDOMUpdate can be called asynchronously from SkipTransition. If the

owning frame is disconnected before the task is executed, calling

ToScriptState on its execution_context_ will result in a nullptr.

Early-return to avoid crashing. There's no need to fulfill the promises

in this case, or reply to the ViewTransition object, since the Document

is shutting down in this case anyway.



Bug: 1489642

Change-Id: I19d213831367957bd12b719edcab07a5e11f941f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4916356

entry.title: Remove a TODO about setting default value for bucket offset.
entry.content:
BucketOffset's value is a Uint128 (https://crsrc.org/c/content/services/auction_worklet/public/mojom/private_aggregation_request.mojom;drc=98da41656ed14c275f3eaf8503ac8862c9bcda48;l=25), which is a struct that we cannot set a default value for. So it is not doable. Without that, inlining the BucketOffset's fields does not benefit much.

entry.title: [ios][web] Fix regression in initialisation of last active time
entry.content:
The documentation of WebState::GetLastActiveTime(), and of the

last_active_time property of WebState::CreateParams state that

last active time should be initialized to the creation time or

to the property value if set.



This appears to have been broken at some point, and causes the

tabs opened in the background to be considered as inactive if

the user never switch to them (which is unexpected).



Change the last_active_time property of WebState::CreateParams

to absl::optional to allow initializing a tab with

a last active time of base::Time().



Fix the regression and add unit tests to validate the behavior

no longer regress in the future.



Fixed: 1490604

Change-Id: I71d6f8baf041e70400675fde187c483965bffcba

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4919176

entry.title: Notify OffscreenCanvas of lost context after a GPU crash
entry.content:
In order for an OffscreenCanvas to recover from a lost context caused by

a GPU crash, it has to be notified of it via NotifyGpuContextLost. This

change adds a check before an existing ResourceProvider is returned from

OffscreenCanvas, in order to call NotifyGpuContextLost if the GPU was

being used and its context has been lost.



A test has been added to check that the context is restored correctly

when issuing new draw calls after the GPU crash.



Bug: 1304051

Change-Id: Id6f0df9e0128a62a7d44b044a485f9b9e83b5d4d

There shouldn't be any change to any layout behavior yet.

entry.title: [APS] Add boolean histogram metrics to track connection state of
entry.content:
keyboard/mouse



Android.InputDevice.Keyboard.Active: Records true when a keyboard is

connected, false when it is subsequently disconnected.

Android.InputDevice.Mouse.Active: Records true when a mouse is

connected, false when it is subsequently disconnected.



Note: The metric for each device type will be emitted only when the

device is connected/disconnected after the app is running, and will not

be emitted for an already connected device.

This change modifies the omnibox focus animation to include

transitioning the height to go from the large fakebox size on the NTP

to the regular omnibox size when focused. When de-focused, the

omnibox animates back to the NTP fakebox size. There is still more

to do to improve the animation, but this handles the size changes.



The animation for non-NTP focus / de-focus is unchanged.



Screen capture of animation:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/Ba9WMdmRgbAALau.png

entry.title: Make the reading mode WebUI toolbar keyboard accessible.
entry.content:
According the the greenlines, tab gets to the first item in the toolbar

(play/pause with read aloud, font without read aloud). Tab again moves

past the toolbar entirely. Left/right arrow keys navigates within the

toolbar and wraps around the front and back. Left/right arrow keys

within the more options menu and the font size menu navigates the menu

and wraps around.



I wasn't able to write tests because the keyboard events don't properly

propagate to the child elements in tests.

entry.title: Revert "[Extensions] Avoid starting a worker when it is kStarting."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 92f1646f89532ae1ff80d9dc010d753db5d5dffb.



Reason for revert: Potentially exposed a stack overflow that occurs when we create the SequencedContextId in ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::AddPendingTask(). crbug.com/1490361



Original change's description:

> [Extensions] Avoid starting a worker when it is kStarting.

>

> This removes one case where we start a service worker in response to an

> event needing to be dispatched.

>

> Before this change we didn't check the running status of a worker and

> instead would start a worker if was starting (kStarting). It's likely

> the worker will start soon and we'll run the task via

> ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::DidStartServiceWorkerContext() or

> ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::DidStartWorkerForScope() though.

>

> This practically means that if multiple tasks built-up while in this

> starting status we would try to start the worker. For example: taskA is

> dispatched and causes the worker to start. TaskB comes into

> ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::AddPendingTask() a moment later when the worker

> hasn't finished starting (and is in kStarting) and we would

> then redundantly attempt to start the worker.

>

> After this change if the worker has

> blink::EmbeddedWorkerStatus::kStarting status when taskB arrives it will

> not cause us to redundantly attempt to start the worker when it is

> already in the kStarting status.

>

> This new behavior is disabled by default and will be enabled with via a

> rollout due to its potential wide impact on MV3/service workers. It is

> effectively gates behind the

> extensions_features:: kExtensionsServiceWorkerOptimizedEventDispatch

> feature check in ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::AddPendingTask().

>

> Bug: 1467015

> Change-Id: I498907d24be2486c8f7d0f5b135bbe297a761344

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4903176

> Commit-Queue: Justin Lulejian

> Reviewed-by: David Bertoni

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1204359}



Bug: 1467015,1490361

Change-Id: I0cfe047eed4d7523b011214a7d1ef0a02e3cbe3d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4916447

Bot-Commit: Rubber Stamper

entry.title: Use char16_t literals for kWebUITabIdDataType and kWebUITabGroupIdDataType.
entry.content:
In almost all places this constant is being used, it was converted at

runtime to UTF16. It is simpler to just start with UTF16 and have the

only place that needs UTF8 do the runtime conversion.



In addition, followup work in //ui/base to use std::u16string_view will

remove the implicit runtime std::u16string temporaries altogether.



Also modernize several patterns adjacent to the code already being

changed:

- Use insert({key, value}) as the preferred idiom for inserting into

maps.

- Eliminate double-lookup in maps by using the iterator returned by

find().



Change-Id: I86b321afa406800cb0f67053a63a4ce4df46470e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4919154

Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting

Commit-Queue: Daniel Cheng

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1206506}

entry.title: [A11y] Remove invalidated object system
entry.content:
Remove the hacky system that notices when a retrieved AXObject is of

the wrong type, and adds it to a queue for an invalidation.



Replace this with a much simpler system that rebuilds AXObject subtrees

that gain or lose layout, from display:none toggles and

display locking state changes.



Benefits:

- Removes ~170 lines of unwanted complexity that leads to performance problems in large changing subtrees.

- More consistent results. The current code needs to "get lucky" in terms of which objects get touched via which objects had a Get() called nearby. In addition, the order of nodes being processed changes based on non-deterministic order of retrieval in the hash map in ProcessInvalidatedObjects(). This has led to flaky test results.

* Performance improvements: average of 50% improvement in ProcessDeferreedAccessibilityEvents() across all perf tests, with some CSS display and display-locking tests improving 200-500%. Average of 45% improvement in SendPendingAccessibilityEvents() across all perf tests.



A future change will remove the now redundant method SafeGet(),

replacing it with Get().



Fixed: 1380449

Change-Id: I75f357647c3f628c0053e47f50957f2e563350d8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4916511

Reviewed-by: Chris Harrelson

Commit-Queue: Aaron Leventhal

entry.title: Change additionalBidKey to be a non-nullable String.
entry.content:
Originally, additionalBidKey was marked as a DOMString? to denote it as

optional, but this isn't what this means.

https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#idl-nullable-type indicates that the

'?' suffix here explicitly allows null to be the value.

This changes removes the '?' suffix, but leaves it as optional, since

it's not marked as required.



Change-Id: Ibaa0fcec93437053c813d7220df6d3ad6cadfcd7

entry.title: [iOS] Mark OverlayContainerCoordinator as stop after it really stops
entry.content:
[OverlayContainerCoordinator stop] crashes on debug build when the app

is killed showing an overlay. This happens because when the overlay

container coordinator is stopped, other overlay implementation updates

the overlay UI, and this requires the coordinator to be "started". We

can workaround this bug by updating the coordinator's `started` flag at

the right time: only mark `started=NO` only when all the work in

`[coordinator stop]` is done.



Fixed: 1489107

entry.title: device_settings: Add button remapping KeyEvent initial metrics
entry.content:
In this CL, the value of the KeyEvent button remapping

action is recorded during the initial metrics logging.



Because we can only log 32 bit ints to UMA, this CL encodes the

KeyEvent before sending it:



A KeyEvent is encoded as an int where the high 28 bits represent the KeyEvent's KeyboardCode/vkey, and the low 4 bits represent the KeyEvent's modifiers.



See the unit tests in this CL for examples.



Note that this CL also adds a few additional tests for GraphicsTablets

and fixes some minor formatting in the unit test file.



Test: ash_unittests -f="*InputDeviceSettingsMetricsManager*"

Bug: b/241965717

entry.title: variations: Abstract all safe seed prefs.
entry.content:
Only read safe seed prefs in a new VariationsSafeSeedLocalState, to make

it easier to override those reads in platform-specific code (e.g. for

CrOS early-boot), and to make it harder to add a new

piece of state for safe seeds without also adding it for CrOS

early-boot.



CrOS early boot, in turn, will generally use the seed passed on the

command line, if there is one.

If there isn't, and a safe seed is requested, we're likely in the

kIdenticalToSafeSeedSentinel case, which means that the latest seed is identical to the safe seed *as stored in Local State*. That logic is

implemented in a child CL. https://crrev.com/c/4678980



BUG=b:263975722,b:299660077

TEST=unit tests

TEST=deploy with child changes; run evaluate_seed \

forcing dev channel; check results

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Add a UMA for V4L2 ioctl requests
entry.content:
This CL adds "Media.V4L2VideoDecoder.VidiocIoctlError" UMA. It records

when an error happens with v4l2 ioctl requests during V4L2 video

decoding session.



- VIDIOC_G_FMT

- VIDIOC_S_FMT

- VIDIOC_G_SELECTION

- VIDIOC_EXPBUF

- VIDIOC_REQBUFS

- VIDIOC_QUERYBUF

- VIDIOC_QBUF

- VIDIOC_DQBUF

- VIDIOC_STREAMON

- VIDIOC_STREAMOFF

- VIDIOC_S_EXT_CTRLS



Note that this CL is intended only for V4L2 stateless decoder. But some

of these ioctl calls are shared also with V4L2 stateful decoder.

SendFinalResultAndWaitForCaretBoundsChanged and instead uses a method

called SendFinalResultAndWaitForSelection. This helps clean up the

testing code as there are fewer methods that do similar

DictationTestSupport.waitForSelection - adding this listener ensures

tests remain stable under heavy load.

entry.title: WebUI: Add ability to manually download NPM deps, without `npm install`.
entry.content:
- Add new download_npm_deps_manually.sh script.

- Hook it up to third_party/node/update_npm_deps

- Update npm_include.txt, npm_exclude.txt accordingly.

- Port third_party/chaijs/chromium.patch.

- Fix minor typo in third_party/node/typescript.patch (left-over

from a previous CL).



This is in preparation of removing third_party/{chaijs, mocha} folders

in favor of third_party/node/node_modules/. The stand-alone folders

provided no automated way of updating to newer versions, and whoever

rolled a new version had to manually find, download and check-in the

new files, which was cumbersome and error-prone.



By moving these dependencies to third_party/node/node_modules, they

can be updated similarly to other WebUI toolchain dependencies using the

third_party/node/update_npm_deps mechanism.



The updated third_party/node/update_npm_deps script is intentionally not

triggered in the same CL, and will be done in a follow-up.

entry.title: Enable rust ffi helpers in base unconditionally
entry.content:
While they will get dropped at link time if they are not used in a

feature (such as on iOS still), by enabling them they get compiled and

passed to the linker and we ensure the toolchain is working for that

everywhere base is used (which is everywhere).



Once this sticks, we can remove the individual GN flags for these and

just guard them on enable_rust in the local BUILD.gn files.

entry.title: Fix and warn on use of "%#0" format specifiers.
entry.content:
%x means "print number as hex". Adding "#" means "prepend 0x"; adding

"0n" (for some decimal n) means "zero-pad to n characters". So it

seems on its face like, say, "%#08x" would be a good way of saying

"print a 32-bit hex value".



There are two problems. The first is that the prefix length is

counted when looking at how much padding is needed, so we would

actually want "%#010x" in this case. But the second, which is worse,

is that for no obvious reason "#" does not prepend "0x" if the value

is zero. So "%#010x" with 0 prints "0000000000" instead of the

desired "0x00000000".



This inconsistency means that "%#" should never be used with zero-

padding (really, with any padding, but there's little incentive to

use it with anything else). Instead, the more obvious "0x%0nx" should

be used.



Bug: none

Change-Id: Iabdc5ca3759ea37a16948c83ad37c729aa49e4c7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4917792

Commit-Queue: Peter Kasting

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Auto-Submit: Peter Kasting

entry.title: [ios] Cleanup BrowserViewWrangler API
entry.content:
Rationalize the API of BrowserViewWrangler to stop exposing internal

logic (such as the requirement to call the methods -createMainBrowser,

-createMainCoordinatorAndInterface and -createInactiveBrowser in that

specific order).



Additionally, the fact that the -incognitoInterface was created in a

lazy way was not used because -[SceneController initialUIMode] needed

to access the -incognitoInterface, thus forcing the creation a few

method call later.



Instead change the BrowserViewWrangler API to



1. create the three Browser (main, inactive, OTR) in initializer,

2. create the two interfaces in -createMainCoordinatorAndInterface,

3. expose a method to request loading the session of all Browsers.



This allow to control when the session is loaded, simplify the logic

to destroy and recreate the OTR ChromeBrowserState (there is no need

to add logic to determine whether the incognito Browser session has

to be loaded or not when the interface is created).



This is a first step to moving to an asynchronous loading of the

sessions, but this would require extensive work, so the API is

left as synchronous for the time being.



Finally, cleanup the implementation of BrowserViewWrangler to remove

internal properties, remove some helper methods that make the code

harder to understand, put methods in the correct `#pragma mark - ...`

section, ...



Update unit tests to reflect the changes made to the API.



Bug: 1383087

Change-Id: Iad85e9b65a3e2db754ebe9dd02203694b33ac2aa

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4908257

Reviewed-by: Mark Cogan

entry.title: [PA] Make base a public_deps of c/safe_browsing/[..]/phishing_classifier
entry.content:
The public interface of this target do include several headers from

base. It means `base` is a `public_deps`, not an internal `deps`.



See GN doc explaining this:

https://gn.googlesource.com/gn/+/master/docs/reference.md#discussion



Context: If we don't apply this patch, the PartitionAllocator library is

not going to be able to stand alone completely. Its public_config is not

going to be properly propagated toward all of its dependants. It will

fail to compile some dependants who do not depends on base explicitly.
